sets.name: 80186_bound
sets.remark: not included in the base 80186 because that set is reused to extend into 64bit, where bound is not

sets.name: 80286_arpl
sets.remark: not included in the base 80286 because that set is reused to extend into 64bit, where arpl is not

sets.name: jcxz
sets.remark: for 16-bit modes, jcxz is treated as jcxz (e.g. 16-bit ecx test)

sets.name: jecxz
sets.remark: for 32-bit modes, jcxz is treated as jecxz (e.g. 32-bit ecx test)

sets.name: extra_instructions
sets.remark: real_mode and long_mode had these instructions in their Opcode enums, but these variants could never be constructed. they were included by accident, and so are ''redundant'' with the extension that added them, but are explicitly noted as an error here.

sets.name: typo_instructions
sets.remark: these instructions never existed, are just transcription errors.

sets.name: cmpxchg16b
sets.remark: appears to be present in all x86-64 machines, though it's hard to find data to confirm

sets.name: avx512_f_typo
sets.remark: these instructions never existed, are just transcription errors.

sets.name: avx_unimplemented
sets.remark: these avx instructions were missed when implementing the various avx* extensions

sets.name: avx512_f__vl_unimplemented
sets.remark: these avx512f instructions were missed when implementing avx512

sets.name: avx512bw_unimplemented
sets.remark: these avx512bw instructions were missed when implementing avx512

sets.name: avx512_vl
sets.remark: not used for opcode generation, since this only adds new modes to existing instructions

sets.name: clmul
sets.remark: this extension is pclmulqdq in a few forms

sets.name: new
sets.remark: misc instruction sets implementing newer features of x86, such as `syscall`, `skinit`, `svm`, `tsx`, `mpx`, and others

uarch.name: long_mode
uarch.remark: pseudo-architecture describing the sum of all x86_64 instructions on various processors and architectures

uarch.name: protected_mode
uarch.remark: pseudo-architecture describing the sum of all x86_32 instructions on various processors and architectures

uarch.name: real_mode
uarch.remark: pseudo-architecture describing the sum of all x86_16 instructions on various processors and architectures

uarch.name: x86_generic
uarch.remark: the union of all instructions in any x86 operation mode. processor can execute all these instructions in a single execution mode, but the generalization can be useful for f.ex generic program disassembly
